message.content:
cs.CV, cs.RO, cs.LG, cs.AI, cs.HC 

This paper focuses on learning human-object interaction from video, which involves computer vision (CV) techniques such as object detection and segmentation. Therefore, cs.CV is the most likely sub-category. Additionally, the paper proposes a model that infers spatial hotspot maps, which can be used for robotics (RO) applications such as object manipulation. The approach also involves machine learning (ML) techniques such as anticipating actions, which falls under the sub-categories of ML (cs.LG) and artificial intelligence (cs.AI). Finally, the paper discusses the value of grounding affordances in real human-object interactions, which relates to human-computer interaction (cs.HC).
